memberdef.name: RNN

briefdescription.para: Create the RNN object.

detaileddescription.para: Optionally, specify which initialize rule and performance function should be used.
If you want to pass in a parameter and discard the original parameter object, be sure to use std::move to avoid unnecessary copy.

parameterdescription.para: Maximum number of steps to backpropagate through time (BPTT).
Predict only the last element of the input sequence.
Output layer used to evaluate the network.
Optional instantiated InitializationRule object for initializing the network parameter.

briefdescription.para: Copy constructor.
Move constructor.
Destructor to release allocated memory.

memberdef.argsstring: (const arma::mat &parameters, const size_t begin, const size_t batchSize, const bool deterministic)
memberdef.name: Evaluate

briefdescription.para: Evaluate the recurrent neural network with the given parameters.

detaileddescription.para: This function is usually called by the optimizer to train the model.

parameterdescription.para: Matrix model parameters.
Index of the starting point to use for objective function evaluation.
Number of points to be passed at a time to use for objective function evaluation.
Whether or not to train or test the model. Note some layer act differently in training or testing mode.

memberdef.argsstring: (const arma::mat &parameters, const size_t begin, const size_t batchSize)
memberdef.name: Evaluate

briefdescription.para: Evaluate the recurrent neural network with the given parameters.

detaileddescription.para: This function is usually called by the optimizer to train the model. This just calls the other overload of Evaluate() with deterministic = true.

parameterdescription.para: Matrix model parameters.
Index of the starting point to use for objective function evaluation.
Number of points to be passed at a time to use for objective function evaluation.

memberdef.argsstring: (const arma::mat &parameters, const size_t begin, GradType &gradient, const size_t batchSize)
memberdef.name: EvaluateWithGradient

briefdescription.para: Evaluate the recurrent neural network with the given parameters.

detaileddescription.para: This function is usually called by the optimizer to train the model.

parameterdescription.para: Matrix model parameters.
Index of the starting point to use for objective function evaluation.
Matrix to output gradient into.
Number of points to be passed at a time to use for objective function evaluation.

memberdef.argsstring: (const arma::mat &parameters, const size_t begin, arma::mat &gradient, const size_t batchSize)
memberdef.name: Gradient

briefdescription.para: Evaluate the gradient of the recurrent neural network with the given parameters, and with respect to only one point in the dataset.

detaileddescription.para: This is useful for optimizers such as SGD, which require a separable objective function.

parameterdescription.para: Matrix of the model parameters to be optimized.
Index of the starting point to use for objective function gradient evaluation.
Matrix to output gradient into.
Number of points to be processed as a batch for objective function gradient evaluation.

briefdescription.para: Return the number of separable functions (the number of predictor points).
Copy assignment operator.
Move assignment operator.
Return the initial point for the optimization.
Modify the initial point for the optimization.
Predict the responses to a given set of predictors.

detaileddescription.para: The responses will reflect the output of the given output layer as returned by the output layer function.
If you want to pass in a parameter and discard the original parameter object, be sure to use std::move to avoid unnecessary copy.

The format of the data should be as follows:
each slice should correspond to a time step
each column should correspond to a data point
each row should correspond to a dimension So, e.g., predictors(i, j, k) is the i'th dimension of the j'th data point at time slice k. The responses will be in the same format.

parameterdescription.para: Input predictors.
Matrix to put output predictions of responses into.
Number of points to predict at once.

briefdescription.para: Get the matrix of data points (predictors).
Modify the matrix of data points (predictors).
Reset the state of the network.

detaileddescription.para: This ensures that all internally-held gradients are set to 0, all memory cells are reset, and the parameters matrix is the right size.

briefdescription.para: Reset the module information (weights/parameters).
Get the matrix of responses to the input data points.
Modify the matrix of responses to the input data points.
Return the maximum length of backpropagation through time.
Modify the maximum length of backpropagation through time.
Serialize the model.
Shuffle the order of function visitation.

detaileddescription.para: This may be called by the optimizer.

memberdef.argsstring: (arma::cube predictors, arma::cube responses, OptimizerType &optimizer, CallbackTypes &&... callbacks)
memberdef.name: Train

briefdescription.para: Train the recurrent neural network on the given input data using the given optimizer.

detaileddescription.para: This will use the existing model parameters as a starting point for the optimization. If this is not what you want, then you should access the parameters vector directly with Parameters() and modify it as desired.
If you want to pass in a parameter and discard the original parameter object, be sure to use std::move to avoid unnecessary copy.

The format of the data should be as follows:
each slice should correspond to a time step
each column should correspond to a data point
each row should correspond to a dimension So, e.g., predictors(i, j, k) is the i'th dimension of the j'th data point at time slice k.

parameterdescription.para: Type of optimizer to use to train the model.
Types of Callback Functions.
Input training variables.
Outputs results from input training variables.
Instantiated optimizer used to train the model.
Callback function for ensmallen optimizer OptimizerType. See https://www.ensmallen.org/docs.html#callback-documentation.

simplesect.para: The final objective of the trained model (NaN or Inf on error).

briefdescription.para: Train the recurrent neural network on the given input data.

detaileddescription.para: By default, the SGD optimization algorithm is used, but others can be specified (such as ens::RMSprop).

This will use the existing model parameters as a starting point for the optimization. If this is not what you want, then you should access the parameters vector directly with Parameters() and modify it as desired.
If you want to pass in a parameter and discard the original parameter object, be sure to use std::move to avoid unnecessary copy.

The format of the data should be as follows:
each slice should correspond to a time step
each column should correspond to a data point
each row should correspond to a dimension So, e.g., predictors(i, j, k) is the i'th dimension of the j'th data point at time slice k.

parameterdescription.para: Type of optimizer to use to train the model.
Types of Callback Functions.
Input training variables.
Outputs results from input training variables.
Callback function for ensmallen optimizer OptimizerType. See https://www.ensmallen.org/docs.html#callback-documentation.

simplesect.para: The final objective of the trained model (NaN or Inf on error).

briefdescription.para: Check if the optimizer has MaxIterations() parameter, if it does then check if it's value is less than the number of datapoints in the dataset.

parameterdescription.para: Type of optimizer to use to train the model.
optimizer used in the training process.
Number of datapoints in the dataset.

briefdescription.para: Check if the optimizer has MaxIterations() parameter, if it doesn't then simply return from the function.

parameterdescription.para: Type of optimizer to use to train the model.
optimizer used in the training process.
Number of datapoints in the dataset.

briefdescription.para: The Backward algorithm (part of the Forward-Backward algorithm).

detaileddescription.para: Computes backward pass for module.

briefdescription.para: The Forward algorithm (part of the Forward-Backward algorithm).

detaileddescription.para: Computes forward probabilities for each module.

parameterdescription.para: Data sequence to compute probabilities for.

briefdescription.para: Iterate through all layer modules and update the the gradient using the layer defined optimizer.
Reset the state of RNN cells in the network for new input sequence.
Reset the module status by setting the current deterministic parameter for all modules that implement the Deterministic function.
Reset the gradient for all modules that implement the Gradient function.
Implementation of a standard recurrent neural network container.

parameterdescription.para: The output layer type used to evaluate the network.
Rule used to initialize the weight matrix.
